/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/TraceToMirrorPoint2.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* TraceToMirrorPoint, Copyright (c) 2004 Michael G. Henderson <mghenderson@lanl.gov>
00002  *
00003  *    - Starting at Minimum-B point, and given a value of mu_eq (mu = cos(pitch angle)),
00004  *  trace up field line to the particle's mirror point. The particle will mirror
00005  *      when B = Beq/(1-mu_eq^2)
00006  *
00007  *
00008  * Permission to use, copy, modify, distribute, and sell this software and its
00009  * documentation for any purpose is hereby granted without fee, provided that
00010  * the above copyright notice appear in all copies and that both that
00011  * copyright notice and this permission notice appear in supporting
00012  * documentation.  No representations are made about the suitability of this
00013  * software for any purpose.  It is provided "as is" without express or
00014  * implied warranty.
00015  *
00016  */
00017 
00018 #include <stdio.h>
00019 #include <stdlib.h>
00020 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00021 #include <omp.h>
00022 
00023 
00024 
00025 int Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, double *Sm, double H0, double Bm, double sgn, double tol, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00026 
00027     Lgm_Vector  u_scale;
00028     double      Htry, Hdid, Hnext, Hmin, Hmax, s;
00029     double      Sa=0.0, Sb=0.0, d;
00030     double      R0, R, Fa, Fb, F;
00031     double      Ra, Rb;
00032     Lgm_Vector  Pa, Pb, P, Bvec;
00033     int         done, reset;
00034 
00035 
00036 
00037     /*
00038      *  mu_eq must be greater than 0.0. For the case of mu_eq = 0.0, just
00039      *  trace to the height of the atmospheric loss cone instead.
00040     if ( fabs(Bm) < 1e-6 ) return( -1 );
00041      */
00042 
00043 
00044     /*
00045      *  H0 is in km above Earth's surface. Convert to geocentric
00046      *  radius. If particle mirrors below this, we are in the loss cone.
00047      */
00048     R0 = H0/Re + 1.0;
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052     Hmax = Info->Hmax;
00053 //    Hmin = 0.001;
00054     Hmin = 1e-7;
00055     u_scale.x =  100.0;  u_scale.y = 100.0; u_scale.z = 100.0;
00056     R = Ra = Rb = 0.0;
00057     F = Fa = Fb = 0.0;
00058 
00059 
00060     /*
00061      *   Add code to check to see if the start point is already below the target height.
00062      *   If it is, we can trace up until we are beyond it or some such thing...
00063      */
00064   
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072     /*
00073      *  Bracket the minimum first. 
00074      *  We want to stop when F = 0.0
00075      *
00076      */
00077 
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081     /* 
00082      *  Set the first point of the bracket to be the start point.
00083      *  A point of caution here...
00084      *  One might think that if Fa is identically zero (or very small) already 
00085      *  then we are done. I.e., if F=0, then the caller was asking for the
00086      *  mirror points of a locally mirroring particle -- so we are done right?
00087      *  Not quite.  The problem with this is that unless we are exactly
00088      *  in the min-B surface already, there are two mirror points: one where we   
00089      *  are already and another some distance away. So dont bail out yet.
00090      */
00091     Pa   = Pb = *u;
00092     Sa   = 0.0;
00093     Info->Bfield( &Pa, &Bvec, Info );
00094     Ra   = Lgm_Magnitude( &Pa );
00095     Fa   = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec ) - Bm;
00096 //printf("Fa = %g\n", Fa);
00097 
00098 
00099     /*
00100      *  Set the step size to be XX% of the (linear) distance to surface of earth
00101      */
00102     Htry = 0.2*(Ra-1.0);
00103 //printf("1. Htry = %g\n", Htry);
00104 
00105 
00106     /*
00107      *  If user doesnt want large steps, limit Htry ...
00108      */
00109     if (Htry > Hmax) Htry = Hmax;
00110 //printf("2. Htry = %g\n", Htry);
00111 
00112 
00113 
00114     /*
00115      *  To begin with, B - Bm will be negative (or zero already). So all we need to do is
00116      *  trace along the F.L. until B - Bm changes sign. That will give us the far side of the bracket.
00117      *  But dont go below 120km altitude.
00118      */
00119     P     = Pa;
00120 
00121     done  = FALSE;
00122     reset = TRUE;
00123 //printf("Initial: Pa, Pb = %g %g %g   %g %g %g   Fa, Fb = %g %g\n", Pa.x, Pa.y, Pa.z, Pb.x, Pb.y, Pb.z, Fa, Fb);
00124 //if ( Fa > 0.0 ) sgn *= -1.0;
00125     while ( !done ) {
00126 
00127         if ( Htry > 0.1 ) Htry = 0.1;
00128 
00129         Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00130 
00131         /*
00132          *  Get value of quantity we want to minimize
00133          */
00134         Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00135         R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00136         F = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec ) - Bm;
00137 
00138 //printf("P = %g %g %g   F = %g Bm = %g |Bvec| = %g\n", P.x, P.y, P.z, F, Bm, Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec ));
00139 
00140         if (   (P.x > Info->OpenLimit_xMax) || (P.x < Info->OpenLimit_xMin) || (P.y > Info->OpenLimit_yMax) || (P.y < Info->OpenLimit_yMin)
00141                 || (P.z > Info->OpenLimit_zMax) || (P.z < Info->OpenLimit_zMin) ) {
00142             /*
00143              *  Open FL!
00144              */
00145             v->x = v->y = v->z = 0.0;
00146             if ( Info->VerbosityLevel > 1 ) printf("TraceToMirrorPoint: FL OPEN\n");
00147 //printf("I got here\n");
00148             return(-2);
00149         } else if ( F > 0.0 ) { /* not >= because we want to explore at least a step beyond */
00150             done = TRUE;
00151             Pb = P;
00152             Rb = R;
00153             Fb = F;
00154             Sb = Sa + Hdid;
00155         } else {
00156             Pa = P;
00157             Ra = R;
00158             Fa = F;
00159             Sa += Hdid;
00160         }
00161         /*
00162          *  Go no farther than some small distance above 
00163          *  the surface of the Earth.
00164          */
00165         Htry = fabs(0.2*(R-0.999999));
00166         if (Htry < 1e-12) done = TRUE;
00167 //printf("Htry = %g R = %g\n", Htry, R);
00168         if ( R < (1.0 + 120.0/Re) ) {
00169             if ( Info->VerbosityLevel > 1 ) printf("Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint: Mirror Height is below 120km -- LOSS CONE \n");
00170             return(-1); /* dropped below 120km -> particle is in loss cone! */
00171         }
00172 //  if (Htry > Hmax) Htry = Hmax;
00173 //  else if (Htry < Hmin) Htry = Hmin;
00174 
00175 //printf("Bracketing: Pa, Pb = %g %g %g   %g %g %g   Fa, Fb = %g %g\n", Pa.x, Pa.y, Pa.z, Pb.x, Pb.y, Pb.z, Fa, Fb);
00176 
00177     }
00178 
00179 //printf("Bracket: Pa, Pb = %g %g %g   %g %g %g   Fa, Fb = %g %g\n", Pa.x, Pa.y, Pa.z, Pb.x, Pb.y, Pb.z, Fa, Fb);
00180 
00181 
00182 
00183 
00184     /*
00185      *  We have a bracket. Now go in for the kill using bisection.
00186      *
00187      *  (Note: If all we wanted to know is whether or not the line hits the
00188      *  Earth, we could stop here: it must hit the Earth or we wouldnt
00189      *  have a minimum bracketed.)
00190      *
00191      */
00192     done  = FALSE;
00193     reset = TRUE;
00194     while (!done) {
00195 
00196         d = Sb - Sa;
00197 
00198         //if ( (d < 1e-8) || (fabs(F) < tol)  ) {
00199         if ( (fabs(d) < tol)  ) {
00200             done = TRUE;
00201         } else {
00202 
00203             P = Pa; Htry = 0.5*d;
00204             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-8, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00205             Info->Bfield( &P, &Bvec, Info );
00206             F = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec ) - Bm;
00207             if ( F >= 0.0 ) {
00208                 Pb = P; Fb = F; Sb = Sa + Hdid;
00209             } else {
00210                 Pa = P; Fa = F; Sa += Hdid; 
00211             }
00212         
00213         }
00214 //printf("Htry = %g  Pa, Pb = %f %f %f,\t %f %f %f   Sa, Sb = %g, %g   F = %g    Fa, Fb = %g %g\n", Htry, Pa.x, Pa.y, Pa.z, Pb.x, Pb.y, Pb.z, Sa, Sb, F, Fa, Fb);
00215 
00216     }
00217 
00218 
00219 
00220     /*
00221      *  Take average of endpoints as final answer
00222      */
00223 //    v->x = 0.5*(Pa.x + Pb.x); v->y = 0.5*(Pa.y + Pb.y); v->z = 0.5*(Pa.z + Pb.z);
00224 //    *Sm = 0.5*(Sa+Sb);
00225     *v = Pb;
00226     *Sm = Sb;
00227 
00228 
00229     return( 1 );
00230 
00231 }
00232
